summary: "Hey Jude" is a famous song by the Beatles, released in 1968. Written by Paul McCartney, it was a huge hit, reaching number one in many countries. The song was inspired by John Lennon's son, Julian, offering comfort and encouragement. Its unique feature is the long "Na-na-na na" coda. Despite the Beatles' internal struggles at the time, the song became one of their most iconic. It remains popular, with McCartney still performing it today.
title: Hey Jude
